Exclusion Criteria Guidelines:  - Difficult airway syndromes: abnormal face, mouth, dentition or neck (eg. micrognathia, Apert’s, Goldenhar’s)  - Sleep apnea, stridor, airway obstruction, severe asthma  - Tracheal abnormalities or compression (e.g. mediastinal mass)  - Severe cardiorespiratory disease  - Gastroesophageal reflux/delayed gastric emptying  - Morbid obesity  - Raised intracranial pressure  - Infants less than 6 months of age  - Severe neurological impairment, severe bulbar dysfunction  - Personal or family history of malignant hyperthermia
dexmedeTOMidine is recommended as first line sedation, followed by chloral hydrate if previous failure and then chlorproMAZINE
